TopicTitle: [B9 Mod] ESP - Extensible Space Plane. A heavy SSTO with bay and rear ramp.

Articles.Content:
Features:

  • An SSTO Spaceplane that can deliver a 75+ ton cargo to 72k+ orbit.
  • Has extendable bay with opening top doors and rear cargo ramp.
  • Easily adjust center of lift / gravity - wings and engines attached by 1 piece.
  • Easily adjust fuel / engine loadout (Minimal balancing issues) as centered on wing.
  • Sample payload included - a refuel/tug drone with 36 tons of rocket fuel, 2.5 tons of RCS fuel and docking ports each end.

Stats:

Parts: 237

Runway weight: 86.49t (Unladen) / 126.67t (Demo load)

Engines: 16x Turbojet, 2x LV-T45

Custom parts: B9 mod only

Installation

============

You need:

KSP 0.20.2 or greater

B9 Aerospace Pack R3 (http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-19-1-b9-aerospace-pack-release-2/)

Orbiting with Mechjeb

================

Throttle Control:

Manage Intakes

Prev Flameout

Prev Overheat

Smooth Throt

Hotkeys

======

1 Main engine

4 Lifter Pri Eng

5 Lifter Sec Eng

7 Bay Doors

0 RCS toggle forwards/back thrusters (Tug payload only)

Modification

=========

To change cargo:

Grab the FIRST (From front) cargo bay door section - the whole wings etc will come away and be easily replaceable

To adjust center of lift / gravity:

Grab the octagonal S2 body section at the base of each wing - slide whole wing up/down as required.

After moving, due to KSP bugs, you may have to:

1) Put engines in action groups again

2) pick up everything behind cockpit and replace (Else struts on symmetry wing do not attach)

To extend cargo bay length:

1) Remove wings (As above)

2) Grab LAST cargo bay door section (with tail attached) - put aside

3) Duplicate (Alt + Click) NEW LAST cargo bay door section and place at end. Repeat as needed

4) Replace tail section.

5) Replace Wings, adjust.

http://evilc.com/files/games/ksp/esp.zip

Nice SSTO, but it always bothers me when people use so few control surfaces...

I did have them all along the wing, but they did not improve control and made the craft unstable, so I removed them.

The secret is the upturned wingtips - without them, yeah you need more control surfaces.

Bear in mind the craft is supremely well balanced - all the weight is in the middle, so you need v little force to rotate it.

Regarding the docking port at the front of the bay: This is NOT attached to the node (That is where the bay attaches), it is surface attached. If you have Edtools, enable vsnap - else place it anywhere on the face, save the craft and edit the file to make the x and y coords of the docking port the same as the cockpit.
